perturbation.original_text: For Product produced at Jasper facilities, Jasper shall invoice Premier on the date Jasper issues a Certificate of Analysis (COA) for those Products. Payment terms for these Product invoices shall be [***]. For Product produced at Heritage facilities, Heritage shall invoice Premier on the date the Products are loaded onto Premier’s carrier. Payment terms for all these Product invoices shall be [***]. Failure by Premier to meet payment terms of any invoice shall result in interest being imposed on any unpaid balance at the rate of [***] per month, pro rata on a daily basis for partial months, accrued from its due date or in the event such rate exceeds that permitted to be charged by law, the maximum rate permitted by law.
perturbation.changed_text: For Product produced at Jasper facilities, Jasper shall invoice Premier on the date Jasper issues a Certificate of Analysis (COA) for those Products. Payment terms for these Product invoices shall be [***]. For Product produced at Heritage facilities, Heritage shall invoice Premier within 15 days of the end of the month in which the Products are loaded onto Premier’s carrier. Payment terms for all these Product invoices shall be net 60 days. Failure by Premier to meet payment terms of any invoice shall result in interest being imposed on any unpaid balance at the rate of [***] per month, pro rata on a daily basis for partial months, accrued from its due date or in the event such rate exceeds that permitted to be charged by law, the maximum rate permitted by law.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces a contradiction regarding the invoicing and payment schedule for products manufactured at Heritage facilities. The original text states that Heritage invoices Premier on the date the Products are loaded onto Premier's carrier, and a specific payment term is applied. The modified text changes the invoicing date to 'within 15 days of the end of the month in which Products are loaded', and applies a 'net 60 days' payment term, creating uncertainty about the exact due date and payment obligations. This could lead to disputes over late payment fees and overall cash flow management.

perturbation.original_text: So long as Premier has satisfied its payment obligations to Heritage pursuant to Section 3, upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, any releasable Product in Heritage’s possession shall be promptly delivered to Premier within [***]. In addition, Premier shall purchase all Products and ingredients, packaging and material Heritage has on hand and not previously billed to Premier at the time of the termination that are used solely for the production of the Products, if any exist. The ingredients, packaging, and materials used solely for Premier shall be so identified in Schedule C and shall not exceed a [***] supply as calculated based on the previous [***] usage for the material in question. If the vendor’s minimum order quantity for a particular material exceeds a [***] supply, then Heritage shall obtain permission from Premier to order such quantity. If Premier grants permission to order the quantity greater than a [***] supply, then Heritage shall not be liable for the excess inventory of this particular material. The cost of all ingredients and packaging material to be purchased by Premier shall be [***]. In the event that Premier has defaulted in its payment obligations hereunder, and failed to cure such default following notice as set forth in Section 11(a), Heritage shall have no obligation to deliver such releasable Product to Premier. In no event, however, shall Heritage have the right to resell or otherwise use the releasable Product held in its custody.
perturbation.changed_text: So long as Premier has satisfied 75% of its payment obligations to Heritage pursuant to Section 3, upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, any releasable Product in Heritage’s possession shall be promptly delivered to Premier within [***]. In addition, Premier shall purchase all Products and ingredients, packaging and material Heritage has on hand and not previously billed to Premier at the time of the termination that are used solely for the production of the Products, if any exist. The ingredients, packaging, and materials used solely for Premier shall be so identified in Schedule C and shall not exceed a [***] supply as calculated based on the previous [***] usage for the material in question. If the vendor’s minimum order quantity for a particular material exceeds a [***] supply, then Heritage shall obtain permission from Premier to order such quantity. If Premier grants permission to order the quantity greater than a [***] supply, then Heritage shall not be liable for the excess inventory of this particular material. The cost of all ingredients and packaging material to be purchased by Premier shall be [***]. In the event that Premier has defaulted in its payment obligations hereunder, and failed to cure such default following notice as set forth in Section 11(a), Heritage shall have no obligation to deliver such releasable Product to Premier. In no event, however, shall Heritage have the right to resell or otherwise use the releasable Product held in its custody.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Premier to have satisfied *all* payment obligations for product delivery upon termination. The change introduces a contradiction by stating that only 75% of payment obligations need to be satisfied for the delivery of releasable product upon termination. This creates ambiguity as to what constitutes sufficient payment and what rights Heritage retains with regard to unsold product. This introduces legal uncertainty and potential disputes about product ownership and financial obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Premier shall have the sole right, exercisable in its discretion, to initiate and direct the content and scope of a recall, market withdrawal, stock recovery, product correction and/or advisory safety communication (any one or more referred to as a “Recall Action”) regarding the Products. At Premier’s option, Premier can direct Heritage to, and upon such direction Heritage shall, conduct such Recall Action (and Heritage shall ensure Jasper’s cooperation). Premier shall determine, in its sole discretion, the manner, text and timing of any publicity to be given such matters upon prior consultation with Heritage. In the event a Recall Action is initiated or directed by Premier, Heritage agrees to fully cooperate and take all such steps as are reasonably requested to implement the Recall Action in a timely and complete manner. Any and all action to be taken in connection with a Recall Action shall be in accordance with FDA policies and other applicable laws and regulations. Heritage shall bear all costs, fees and out-of-pocket expenses associated with any Recall Action which results from (i) Heritage’s or Jasper’s negligence or willful misconduct, (ii) Heritage’s or Jasper’s failure to comply with Product Specifications or the Post Holdings Quality Expectations Manual set forth on Schedule A, (iii) any breach of this Agreement by Heritage or (iv) ingredients or packaging materials purchased by Heritage or Jasper. In all other cases, Premier shall bear all costs associated with any Recall Action.
perturbation.changed_text: Premier shall have the sole right, exercisable in its discretion, to initiate and direct the content and scope of a recall, market withdrawal, stock recovery, product correction and/or advisory safety communication (any one or more referred to as a “Recall Action”) regarding the Products. At Heritage’s discretion, Premier can direct Heritage to, and upon such direction Heritage shall, conduct such Recall Action (and Heritage shall ensure Jasper’s cooperation). The decision to conduct a recall will be at Premier’s sole discretion. Heritage will determine the manner, text and timing of any publicity to be given such matters upon prior consultation with Premier. In the event a Recall Action is initiated or directed by Premier, Heritage agrees to fully cooperate and take all such steps as are reasonably requested to implement the Recall Action in a timely and complete manner. Any and all action to be taken in connection with a Recall Action shall be in accordance with FDA policies and other applicable laws and regulations. Heritage shall bear all costs, fees and out-of-pocket expenses associated with any Recall Action which results from (i) Heritage’s or Jasper’s negligence or willful misconduct, (ii) Heritage’s or Jasper’s failure to comply with Product Specifications or the Post Holdings Quality Expectations Manual set forth on Schedule A, (iii) any breach of this Agreement by Heritage or (iv) ingredients or packaging materials purchased by Heritage or Jasper. In all other cases, Premier shall bear all costs associated with any Recall Action.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives Premier the sole discretion to initiate and direct the recall action and indicates if Premier directs Heritage, Heritage *shall* conduct the recall action. The modified text states 'At Heritage's discretion, Premier can direct Heritage to conduct a Recall Action' and 'the decision to conduct a recall will be at Premier's sole discretion'. This introduces a direct contradiction. It also modifies which party determines the manner, text and timing of publicity, introducing more conflict and uncertainty. The overall effect is to cloud the decision-making and operational responsibility for recall actions.
